cards.text:

Draw a card.
cards.originalText:

cards.name: Forgotten Cave
cards.text:
Forgotten Cave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Forgotten Cave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:

cards.name: Nivix, Aerie of the Firemind
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{2}{U}{R}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until your next turn, you may cast that card if it's an instant or sorcery card.
cards.flavor: Niv-Mizzet's genius and vanity reverberate throughout the mirrored halls of Nivix.

rulings.text: "Until your next turn" means the effect wears off as soon as your next turn starts, even before you untap. It's basically the same as "until the end of the turn of the player who immediately precedes you."

The card is cast using all normal rules and restrictions for casting spells. Casting it means you'll have to pay its mana cost, and it will go to the graveyard after it resolves or is countered. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.
If you don't cast the card, it stays exiled.

foreignNames.name: 火想者の高巣、ニヴィックス

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}{U}{R}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until your next turn, you may cast that card if it's an instant or sorcery.

cards.name: Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord
cards.text:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Jarad's first ability applies only when Jarad is on the battlefield.
The life loss is based on the power of the sacrificed creature as it last existed on the battlefield.

To activate Jarad's last ability, you must sacrifice two lands. It doesn't matter what other land types the two lands have, as long as one is a Swamp and one is a Forest. Even if one of the lands you sacrifice is both a Swamp and a Forest, you have to sacrifice another land that is a Swamp or a Forest.
You can sacrifice any land with the land type Swamp or Forest, not just ones named Swamp or Forest. For example, you could sacrifice two Overgrown Tombs.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの死者の王、ジャラド

cards.originalText:
Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord gets +1/+1 for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}{B}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: Each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power.
Sacrifice a Swamp and a Forest: Return Jarad from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Plagued Rusalka
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Look at her, once filled with innocence. Death has a way of wringing away such . . . deficiencies."
—Savra
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Elves of Deep Shadow
cards.text: {T}: Add {B}. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Cast out of the Conclave generations ago, these elves found a home in the corrupted districts of the Golgari.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool. Elves of Deep Shadow deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Golgari Thug
cards.text:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly four cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
When Golgari Thug dies, put target creature card from your graveyard on top of your library.
Dredge 4 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly four cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Devouring books is only the beginning. The librarian's next.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Reassembling Skeleton
cards.text: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor:
"They may show up with the wrong thigh bone or mandible, but they always show up."
—Zul Ashur, lich lord
cards.originalText: {1}{B}: Return Reassembling Skeleton from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Boneyard Wurm
cards.text: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: The only thing it likes more than discovering a pit of bones is adding to it.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Boneyard Wurm is in your graveyard, it will count itself.

cards.originalText: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Korozda Guildmage
cards.text:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Create X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Use the sacrificed creature's toughness when it was last on the battlefield to determine the value of X.

foreignNames.name: コロズダのギルド魔道士

cards.originalText:
{1}{B}{G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains intimidate until end of turn.
{2}{B}{G}, Sacrifice a nontoken creature: Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Putrid Leech
cards.text: Pay 2 life: Putrid Leech gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: It reacted to Naya's overabundant food supply by growing additional mouths.
cards.originalText: Pay 2 life: Putrid Leech gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Stinkweed Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
Notably, Stinkweed Imp's ability isn't deathtouch. It's a triggered ability that triggers only on combat damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Stinkweed Imp deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
Dredge 5 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly five cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Eternal Witness
cards.text: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: She remembers every word spoken, from the hero's oath to the baby's cry.
cards.originalText: When Eternal Witness enters the battlefield, you may return target card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Dreg Mangler
cards.text:
Haste
Scavenge {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

rulings.text: Exiling the creature card with scavenge is part of the cost of activating the scavenge ability. Once the ability is activated and the cost is paid, it's too late to stop the ability from being activated by trying to remove the creature card from the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Scavenge {3}{B}{G} ({3}{B}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Put a number of +1/+1 counters equal to this card's power on target creature. Scavenge only as a sorcery.)

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Brain Weevil
cards.text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Sacrifice Brain Weevil: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)

cards.text: Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)
cards.flavor: Man's best fungus.

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)

cards.name: Golgari Grave-Troll
cards.text:
Golgari Grave-Troll enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each creature card in your graveyard.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Golgari Grave-Troll: Regenerate Golgari Grave-Troll.
Dredge 6 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly six cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: If an effect puts Golgari Grave-Troll onto the battlefield from your graveyard, Golgari Grave-Troll counts itself as one of the cards in your graveyard and gets a counter accordingly.
Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

cards.name: Stingerfling Spider
cards.text:
Reach
When Stingerfling Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor: The juiciest prey is that which grows lazy, thinking itself beyond the reach of danger.

rulings.text: You choose the target creature with flying when the ability goes on the stack. When it resolves, you choose whether or not to destroy the creature.

cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
When Stingerfling Spider enters the battlefield, you may destroy target creature with flying.

cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Victory in the pits is almost as rewarding as the methods I use to achieve it."

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Target player discards two cards. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Like corpse-worms through a carapace, rotwurms slide through the hollowed bones of the undercity.

foreignNames.name: ゴルガリの腐れワーム

cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Target player loses 1 life.

cards.name: Gleancrawler
cards.text:
({B/G} can be paid with either {B} or {G}.)
Trample
At the beginning of your end step, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

rulings.text: When this ability resolves, it returns all creature cards currently in your graveyard that were put there directly from the battlefield sometime during the turn. This includes cards that were put into your graveyard before Gleancrawler entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of your end step, return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.

cards.name: Doomgape
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.

rulings.text: If you have no other creatures to sacrifice, you'll have to sacrifice Doomgape itself. You'll gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.originalText:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.name: Golgari Signet
cards.flavor: Depending on your point of view, the seal represents a proud guardian of the natural cycle or one who has sold her soul to darkness for eternal life.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Add {B}{G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Ghoul's Feast
cards.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Mercadians not wealthy enough to buy a tomb are thrown into a bog called "the Ghoul's Larder."
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
When a creature dies, destroy enchanted creature.
cards.flavor: The demon's yoke is part leash, part noose.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When a creature dies, destroy enchanted creature.

cards.name: Life from the Loam
cards.text:
Return up to three target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.

Dredge 3 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly three cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Golgari Germination
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
cards.flavor: The Golgari don't bury their dead. They plant them.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Putrefy
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"All matter, animate or not, rots when exposed to time. We merely speed up the process."
—Ezoc, Golgari rot farmer

rulings.text: This spell isn't Modal. When it resolves, it will destroy the target if it's a creature or an artifact, even if it changed from one to the other between targeting and resolution.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Feast or Famine
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
• Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The living cannot understand the benefits of death."
—Chaeska, Keeper of Tresserhorn
cards.originalText: Choose one — Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield; or destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature and it can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Nightmare Void
cards.text:
Target player reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.
Once you decide to replace a draw using a card's dredge ability, that card can't be removed from your graveyard "in response." (Replacement effects don't use the stack.)
You can't use dredge unless you're going to draw a card and the card with dredge is already in your graveyard.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText:
Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
Dredge 2 (If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly two cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

cards.name: Vigor Mortis
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: After fear and weakness rot away, that which remains is stronger than its living form.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counter from this ability is in addition to any other counters the creature enters the battlefield with.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If {G} was spent to cast Vigor Mortis, that creature enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Grim Flowering
cards.text: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Nothing in nature goes to waste, not even the rotting corpse of a good-for-nothing, blood-sucking vampire."
—Halana of Ulvenwald

rulings.text: Count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when Grim Flowering resolves.

cards.originalText: Draw a card for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Twilight's Call
cards.text:
You may cast Twilight's Call as though it had flash if you pay {2} more to cast it. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)
Each player returns all creature cards from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
Twilight falls. We rise.
—Necropolis inscription

rulings.text: All the creature cards enter the battlefield simultaneously.

For purposes of ordering any continuous effects of the creatures, the current player (not the controller of this spell) decides the ordering regardless of which player is putting the creatures onto the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
You may cast Twilight's Call any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Life
cards.text: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All lands you control become 1/1 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.

cards.originalText:

rulings.text: Dredge lets you replace any card draw, not just the one during your draw step.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.name: Svogthos, the Restless Tomb
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{3}{B}{G}: Until end of turn, Svogthos, the Restless Tomb becomes a black and green Plant Zombie creature with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard." It's still a land.

rulings.text: While animated, Svogthos's power and toughness changes each time a creature card enters or leaves its controller's graveyard.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

foreignNames.name: 安息の無い墓、スヴォグトース

cards.name: Venser, the Sojourner
cards.text:
+2: Exile target permanent you own. Return it to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.
−1: Creatures can't be blocked this turn.
−8: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell, exile target permanent."

rulings.text: Emblems behave similarly to enchantments: They have an ability that, in a general sense, continually affects the game. The primary difference between them is that emblems aren't permanents and don't exist on the battlefield. Nothing in the game can remove an emblem, simply because no other spell or ability references them. Once you get an emblem, you keep it for the rest of the game. Emblems have no color, name, card type, or other characteristics beyond the listed ability.
The first ability can target any permanent you own, including those another player controls.
If the first ability exiles a token, that token will cease to exist. It won't return to the battlefield.
A permanent exiled by the first ability will return to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step even if you no longer control Venser at that time.

Venser's second ability doesn't lock in what it applies to. That's because the effect states a true thing about creatures, but doesn't actually change the characteristics of those creatures. As a result, all creatures can't be blocked that turn, including creatures you don't control, creatures that weren't on the battlefield at the time the ability resolved, and creatures that have lost all abilities.

Venser's last ability creates an emblem with a triggered ability. The emblem is the source of the triggered ability. Because emblems are colorless, you can target permanents with protection from white or from blue, for example, with the triggered ability.
Whenever you cast a spell, the emblem's ability triggers and goes on the stack on top of it. It will resolve before the spell does.
If you control more than one such emblem, each one's ability will trigger separately whenever you cast a spell.

cards.originalText:
+2: Exile target permanent you own. Return it to the battlefield under your control at the beginning of the next end step.
-1: Creatures are unblockable this turn.
-8: You get an emblem with "Whenever you cast a spell, exile target permanent."

cards.name: Whitemane Lion
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Whitemane Lion enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Saltfield nomads call a sudden storm a "whitemane."

rulings.text: You may return this creature itself to its owner's hand as its triggered ability resolves. If you don't control enough other creatures, you must return it.
The ability doesn't target any creature. You don't choose what to return until the ability resolves. Once the ability has started to resolve, no one can respond to the choice.

foreignNames.name: 白たてがみのライオン

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Whitemane Lion enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Augury Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Augury Owl enters the battlefield, scry 3. (Look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Augury Owl enters the battlefield, scry 3. (To scry 3, look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Coral Fighters
cards.text: Whenever Coral Fighters attacks and isn't blocked, look at the top card of defending player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: Whenever Coral Fighters attacks and isn't blocked, look at the top card of defending player's library. You may put that card on the bottom of that player's library.

cards.name: Minamo Sightbender
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: Woven from threads of the spirit world, the mistcloak rendered its wearer invisible, but quickly fell to tatters.
cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Target creature with power X or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Mistmeadow Witch
cards.text: {2}{W}{U}: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor: Olka collected the evening mist for years, studying its secrets. Once she learned its essence, she could vanish with a thought.
cards.originalText: {2}{W}{U}: Exile target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Scroll Thief
cards.text: Whenever Scroll Thief deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.
cards.flavor: I've learned how to disable wards, pick locks, and decode the Agaran language—all before even reading the scroll!

rulings.text: The ability triggers just once each time Scroll Thief deals combat damage to a player, regardless of how much damage it deals.
The ability is mandatory. You must draw a card when it resolves.

cards.originalText: Whenever Scroll Thief deals combat damage to a player, draw a card.

cards.name: Neurok Invisimancer
cards.text:
Neurok Invisimancer can't be blocked.
When Neurok Invisimancer enters the battlefield, target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor: "They won't see your shadow or hear your breath, but they will feel your blade."

foreignNames.name: ニューロックの透術士

cards.originalText:
Neurok Invisimancer is unblockable.
When Neurok Invisimancer enters the battlefield, target creature is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Slith Strider
cards.text:
Whenever Slith Strider becomes blocked, draw a card.
Whenever Slith Strider deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: A slith's form and function are determined by the color of the sun under which it's born.
cards.originalText:
Whenever Slith Strider becomes blocked, draw a card.
Whenever Slith Strider deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Sky Spirit
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor:
"Like a strain of music: easy to remember but impossible to catch."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Wall of Denial
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: It provides what every discerning mage requires—time to think.
cards.originalText:
Defender, flying
Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.name: Galepowder Mage
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Galepowder Mage attacks, exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Galepowder Mage's ability can target a creature controlled by any player. It's not optional.
The exiled card will be returned to the battlefield at the beginning of the end step even if Galepowder Mage is no longer on the battlefield at that time.
If Galepowder Mage is the only creature on the battlefield when it attacks, its ability has no effect.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Galepowder Mage attacks, exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Kor Cartographer
cards.text: When Kor Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Kor have no concept of exploration. They return to homelands forgotten.
cards.originalText: When Kor Cartographer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Plains card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The shapeshifter mimics with a twin's esteem and a mirror's cruelty.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.

Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.

Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can't become a copy of that creature. You may choose only a creature that's already on the battlefield.
You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.
Clone's ability doesn't target the chosen creature.

cards.originalText: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

cards.name: Cryptic Annelid
cards.text: When Cryptic Annelid enters the battlefield, scry 1, then scry 2, then scry 3. (To scry X, look at the top X cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

rulings.text: You do the three different scry actions in sequence, in the order they're printed on the card.

cards.originalText: When Cryptic Annelid enters the battlefield, scry 1, then scry 2, then scry 3. (To scry X, look at the top X cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Primal Plasma
cards.text: As Primal Plasma enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 creature, a 2/2 creature with flying, or a 1/6 creature with defender.
cards.flavor: Tocasia brushed the gears and cogs from the table. There, before two wide-eyed brothers, she began a lesson on raw elemental magic.

rulings.text: If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of Primal Plasma, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for Primal Plasma when it entered the battlefield.
This is the timeshifted version of Primal Clay.
In zones other than the battlefield, this creature card is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of this creature, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for this creature as it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: As Primal Plasma enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 creature, a 2/2 creature with flying, or a 1/6 creature with defender.

cards.name: Sawtooth Loon
cards.text:
Flying
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, return a white or blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, draw two cards, then put two cards from your hand on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: Both triggered abilities trigger at the same time so you can decide which order they go on the stack. If you have no cards in hand, you would likely choose the order where you draw and put on the library before unsummoning the creature that is on the battlefield.
You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, return a white or blue creature you control to its owner's hand.
When Sawtooth Loon enters the battlefield, draw two cards, then put two cards from your hand on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Cache Raiders
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: What the current doesn't take, they do.

rulings.text: This ability isn't targeted. You choose a permanent to return when the ability resolves. No one will be able to respond to the choice.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Windreaver
cards.text:
Flying
{W}: Windreaver gains vigilance until end of turn.
{W}: Windreaver gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Switch Windreaver's power and toughness until end of turn.
{U}: Return Windreaver to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
Switching a creature's power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}: Windreaver gains vigilance until end of turn.
{W}: Windreaver gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}: Switch Windreaver's power and toughness until end of turn.
{U}: Return Windreaver to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Jedit's Dragoons
cards.text:
Vigilance
When Jedit's Dragoons enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: After Efrava was destroyed, the cat warriors scattered across Dominaria. Those who followed Jedit's example were strong enough to survive the ravages of apocalypse.

foreignNames.name: ジェディットの竜騎兵

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
When Jedit's Dragoons enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Sunblast Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Sunblast Angel enters the battlefield, destroy all tapped creatures.
cards.flavor: There may exist powers even greater than Phyrexia.

rulings.text: The second ability destroys each creature that's tapped at the time it resolves, including creatures you control. If Sunblast Angel has become tapped by the time its ability resolves, it will be destroyed too.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sunblast Angel enters the battlefield, destroy all tapped creatures.

cards.name: Sphinx of Uthuun
cards.text:
Flying
When Sphinx of Uthuun enters the battlefield, reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

rulings.text: You (not your opponent) choose which pile to put into your hand and which to put into your graveyard.
A pile can have no cards in it. In this case, you'll choose whether to put all the revealed cards into your hand or into your graveyard.

In multiplayer games, you choose an opponent to separate the cards when the ability resolves. This doesn't target that opponent. Because the cards are revealed, all players may see the cards and offer opinions.

foreignNames.name: ウスーンのスフィンクス

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sphinx of Uthuun enters the battlefield, reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.

cards.name: Path to Exile
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle their library.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target by the time Path to Exile would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. The creature's controller won't search for a basic land card.
The controller of the exiled creature isn't required to search their library for a basic land. If that player doesn't, the player won't shuffle their library.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.name: Preordain
cards.text: Scry 2, then draw a card. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)
cards.originalText: Scry 2, then draw a card. (To scry 2, look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

cards.name: Sigil of Sleep
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a player, return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Arrows are only one way to remove an enemy.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a player, return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Revoke Existence
cards.text: Exile target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"No half measures, no regrets. We'll tell no stories of this day. It will be as if it never existed at all."
—Ganedor, loxodon mystic
cards.originalText: Exile target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Angelic Shield
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Sacrifice Angelic Shield: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"If only an angel's wings could shelter us all."
—Barrin, master wizard

rulings.text: Angelic Shield goes to the graveyard when you activate the ability, but the targeted creature does not get returned until the ability resolves. All your creatures lose the bonus while the ability is on the stack which may result in the targeted creature being destroyed before the return can take effect.

cards.originalText:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Sacrifice Angelic Shield: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.

If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).

If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.

Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

cards.originalText:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Safe Passage
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.
cards.flavor: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.

rulings.text: Safe Passage prevents all damage, not just combat damage, that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.
Safe Passage will prevent damage dealt to creatures that weren't on the battlefield at the time it resolved.
Safe Passage doesn't prevent damage that would be dealt to planeswalkers you control.
Safe Passage has no effect on damage that's already been dealt.

cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.

cards.name: Steel of the Godhead
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and can't be blocked.

rulings.text: If the enchanted creature is both of the listed colors, it will get both bonuses.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and is unblockable.

cards.name: Vanish into Memory
cards.text: Exile target creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power. At the beginning of your next upkeep, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, discard cards equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Out of sight, into mind.

rulings.text: Vanish into Memory cares about the creature's power just before it left the battlefield and its toughness just after it returns to the battlefield. For example, if you target a 2/2 creature with two +1/+1 counters on it, you'll draw four cards, then when it returns to the battlefield without any counters on it, you'll discard two cards.
If the creature exiled with Vanish into Memory never returns to the battlefield (because it was a token creature, for example), you don't discard any cards.

If the creature exiled with Vanish into Memory isn't a creature card (for example, a crewed Vehicle), that card will still be returned to the battlefield, but not as a creature. Since the card returned to the battlefield has no toughness, you discard no cards.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. You draw cards equal to that creature's power. At the beginning of your next upkeep, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control. If you do, discard cards equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Overrule
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. You gain X life.
cards.flavor: With one commanding word, the spell was put down and a fine collected for its casting.

rulings.text: You gain the life whether or not the spell's controller pays {X} and whether or not the spell is countered.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. You gain X life.

cards.name: Azorius Chancery
cards.text:
Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield tapped.
When Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{U}.

rulings.text: If this land enters the battlefield and you control no other lands, its ability will force you to return it to your hand.

cards.originalText:

When Azorius Chancery enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {W}{U} to your mana pool.

cards.text:
Flood Plain enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Flood Plain: Search your library for a Plains or Island card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Flood Plain enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Flood Plain: Search your library for a Plains or Island card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
